for my case I used malloc(1000*1024*1024), in order 
to see swapping from swap space to RAM and vice verca 
Case without free(memory): 
    After 4th time of allocating memory the "so" has increased due to 
    the needs of having more physical memory and moving less active processes 
    to the swap space.
    4th-iteration : 
    Memory usage: 4097280 KB

11  2 2021808 145216   8392 557044   24 4196  3927  4196 1554  700  2 60 30  8  0

        And it was increasing till the end of execution of the programm.
    Also I noticed that in some part of moments we also had the value of "si" -
    which means that our processes moving back from swap space to RAM

    The case with free(memory): 
    After 1st iteration we see that memory usage become the same.
    And I did not indicate any increasing for the value "so"(but in the 1st iteration,
    it was some value) after 1st iteration it was some changing for "si": 
    procs -----------memory---------- ---swap-- -----io---- -system-- ------cpu-----
